My name is Jerome Dinal Herath. I am a Computer Science PHD candidate @ State University of New York (SUNY) Binghamton. My current research revolves around Interpretable and Adversarial Machine Learning.

Recent Publications

  • Real-Time Evasion Attacks against Deep Learning-Based Anomaly Detection from Distributed System Logs by J. Dinal Herath, Ping Yang and Guanhua Yan. In: Proceedings of The 11th ACM Conference on Data and Application Security and Privacy (CODASPY) (2021). [Accepted]
  • RAMP: Real-Time Anomaly Detection in Scientific Workflows by J. Dinal Herath, Changxin Bai, Guanhua Yan, Ping Yang, Shiyong Lu. In: IEEE International Conference on Big Data (2019). [extended version]
  • SciBlock: A Blockchain-Based Tamper-Proof Non-Repudiable Storage for Scientific Workflow Provenance by Dinuni Fernando, Siddharth Kulshrestha, J. Dinal Herath, Nitin Mahadik, Yanzhe Ma, Changxin Bai, Ping Yang, Guanhua Yan, Shiyong Lu. In: IEEE International Conference on Collaboration and Internet Computing (2019).
